text: Fermat's little theorem is a theorem from number theory. It is named after Pierre de Fermat who found it in the 17th century. It is about the properties of primes. It says that if a is a number, and p is a prime number, then in the notation of modular Arithmetic, it can be expressed as, :a^p \equiv a\,(\mathrm{mod}\,p), If a is not a multiple of p, then the following is often used: :a^{p-1} \equiv 1\,(\mathrm{mod}\,p) Category:Theorems in number theory
title: Fermat's little theorem
